text: Andrus Aug (born 22 May 1972) is a retired Estonian professional road bicycle racer. He last rode for UCI Professional Continental team Ceramica Flaminia. == Palmares == ;1997 : 3rd, National Road Race Championship ;1999 : 2nd, National Road Race Championship ;2001 : 1st, Trophy Riviera 3 : 1st, GP Città di Rio Saliceto e Correggio : 1st, Stages 1 & 5, Course de la Solidarité Olympique : 1st, Stages 1, 7, 8, 9 & 13, Tour of Maroc : 1st, Stage 5, Tour de Bulgarie : 3rd, National Road Race Championship ;2002 : 1st, Gran Premio Nobili Rubinetterie : 1st, Trophy Porec 4 : 1st, Trofeo Città di Borgomanero : 1st, Stage 2, Tour of Poland : 1st, Stage 9, Peace Race : 1st, Stage 1, Course de la Solidarité Olympique : 1st, Stage 4, Tour of Slovakia : 1st, Stage 3, Jadranska Magistrala ;2004 : 1st, GP de la Ville de Rennes ;2005 : 1st, Stage 4, Giro del Trentino : 1st, Stage 4, Saaremaa Velotuur ;2006 : 1st, Overall, Saaremaa Velotuur :: Winner Stages 2, 5 & 6 ;2007 : 1st, Stage 4, Saaremaa Velotuur == External links == * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Jõgeva Category:Estonian male cyclists Category:Olympic cyclists of Estonia Category:Cyclists at the 2004 Summer Olympics
title: Andrus Aug
